original: Block, Knut David Herder, teol. dr, kontraktsprost, kyrkoherde, Kinna, f. 16/6/85 i Örby, Älvsb. 1., av kontr:-prost Herder B. o. frih:an Cecilia Sparre. G. 36 m. Gertrud Andersson. — Stud:ex. i Gbg 03, teol. fil. ex. 04, teol. kand. 06, prakt. teol. prov 06, teol. lic. 12, prästv. f. Gbgs stift 12, teol. dr 18. Kommin. i Örby 16, kyr-koh. där sed. 22, kontr :prost 32. Ordf. i Örby kyrkofullm., led. av komm:-fullm. o. barnavind i Örby, insp. f. Kinna- samrealskola, ordf. i Marks o. Bollebygdskrets. av fören. Fol-ksk. vänner o. i Marks o. Kindskrets, av ASP, led. av ASP centr:styr. Res. t. Tyskl. Skr.: Karl IX s. teolog o. religiös personlighet. LNO.
translated: Block, Knut David Herder, theological doctor, parish dean, vicar, Kinna, born on June 16, 1885 in Örby, Älvsborgs län. Father: parish dean Herder B. and the noblewoman Cecilia Sparre. Married in 1936 to Gertrud Andersson. He graduated from high school in Gothenburg in 1903, received his theological degree in 1904, became a theology candidate in 1906, passed his practical theology exam in 1906, received his licentiate in theology in 1912, was ordained for the Gothenburg diocese in 1912, and received his doctorate in theology in 1918. He was a curate in Örby from 1916, vicar there since 1922, and parish dean since 1932. He was chairman of the Örby church council, member of the local council and children's welfare in Örby, inspector for the Kinna secondary school, chairman of the Mark and Bollebygd district of the People's School Friends Association and Mark and Kinna district of the ASP, and member of the ASP Central Board. He wrote a book on King Karl IX as a theological and religious person. He was awarded the LNO (Nordic Order of Merit).

memberOf.name: Marks o. Bollebygdskrets av fören. Fol-ksk. vänner
